title: Krazy-E
author: Krazy-E
content: Hi!Anyone in here can still spool TXIDs with some top tier mining pool?Had great luck with OG members in the past but seems they are not as active today.Thanks!

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: I don't see there's a legit user offer acceleration service anymore, I think the current user who promote such acceleration service is just re-broadcast the transactions.You can use viabtc, although your transaction need to meet their requirement and only limited for 100 transactions per hour.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: There is one member actively doing this this month.FREE/PAY BITCOIN TRANSACTION ACCELERATOR provided by spider703.Quote from: spider703 on November 30, 2023, 03:16:14 AMadded

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: ViaBTC's transaction accelerator is the only one that worked for me: viabtc.com/tools/txacceleratorTip: accelerations are limited to a certain number every hour, so be ready to submit your tx after every hour(xx:00).

comments.author: odolvlobo
comments.created_time: November 30, 2023, 06:37:22 AMLast edit: November 30, 2023, 06:52:35 AM by odolvlobo
comments.body: Quote from: hd49728 on November 30, 2023, 05:52:19 AMThere is one member actively doing this this month.FREE/PAY BITCOIN TRANSACTION ACCELERATOR provided by spider703.Quote from: spider703 on November 30, 2023, 03:16:14 AMaddedIs that charlatan still active? Please understand that only a miner can "accelerate" a transaction by putting it in their next block.spider703 claims to accelerate a transaction, but he really does nothing except perhaps submit it to viabtc's acceleration page. He is hoping that when the transaction is eventually confirmed on its own or by viabtc, the sender will believe that he helped and and then tip him.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on November 30, 2023, 06:02:42 AMViaBTC's transaction accelerator is the only one that worked for me: viabtc.com/tools/txacceleratorTip: accelerations are limited to a certain number every hour, so be ready to submit your tx after every hour(xx:00).ViaBTC free accelerator works if the transaction have the criteria given for transaction to be submitted for acceleration. Criteria like having less than 500 bytes, having at least 10 sat/byte fee. Also that a transaction that has parent transaction can not be accelerated.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Quote from: Krazy-E on November 30, 2023, 04:58:55 AMHi!Anyone in here can still spool TXIDs with some top tier mining pool?Without knowing anyone connected to a mining pool, all you can do is rebroadcast the transaction. Since you will be paying that person, it is better to use a wallet that supports RBF and rebroadcast the transaction instead of searching for a mining pool.The only mining pool that provides an open service to everyone is ViaBTC, but with certain conditions. You can ask in the mining pools section here if there is someone else who can help you, but it is a waste of time. Switch to a wallet that supports RBF.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Husires on November 30, 2023, 09:23:31 AMSince you will be paying that person, it is better to use a wallet that supports RBF and rebroadcast the transaction instead of searching for a mining pool.Rebroadcasting a transaction is usually useless and note that you don't have to use a wallet that supports RBF for that. For rebroadcasting a transaction, all you need is the raw transaction. If you have the raw transaction, there are many tools that can be used for rebroadcasting the transaction.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: There are so many scammers that do not control or cooperate with any mining pool, but they claim that they can accelerate tx's, but what they indeed do is just to rebroadcast your tx, so don't give your money to just anyone who claims they can accelerate your tx. A few mining pools run paid accelerating services, but it is too expensive and instead of using it you better pay an appropriate fee or use rbf to bump your tx. ViaBTC is the only mining pool that offers a working tx free accelerator, use them if you meet the requirements.

comments.author: WhyFhy
comments.body: If you control your wallet and TX is pending you can change the fee. Check mempool and see the priority fee. Right now it's 31 sat/vB , 12 hours ago it was double that.You can adjust your fee to be included in the top/next block mined, or you can rebroadcast your txid to get placed back on top of the que of your current fee (if 200 people have done the same fee as you since you submitted your TX your under those 200 people, if you rebroadcast you'll be at the top of that fee que.) Hope this helps.

comments.author: Krazy-E
comments.body: Yeah, thanks everyone. For some reasons there was a fee miscal and it was set at 33sats.It eventually passed a few hours back.I know I could have used RBF and importing in Electrum, but I figured the old acceleration way like Mike and some others were doing while working for mining pools were top tier help.Thanks for all the inputs.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Quote from: Krazy-E on November 30, 2023, 03:34:12 PMYeah, thanks everyone. For some reasons there was a fee miscal and it was set at 33sats.It eventually passed a few hours back.I know I could have used RBF and importing in Electrum, but I figured the old acceleration way like Mike and some others were doing while working for mining pools were top tier help.Thanks for all the inputs.OP, you can read this thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5474868.msg63194470#msg63194470 to get more information on ViaBTC accelerator free service. Comments was also made and you can also have more ideas from them.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: Quote from: Frankolala on November 30, 2023, 08:26:37 PMOP, you can read this thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5474868.msg63194470#msg63194470 to get more information on ViaBTC accelerator free service. Comments was also made and you can also have more ideas from them.According to OP's last message, the transaction in question has since been confirmed without any sort of transaction acceleration service or utilizing the RBF feature. In hindsight, the accelerator service is hard to get in since it's capped per hour and if the mempool is free, no need to accelerate a tx.

comments.author: panganib999
comments.body: Saw someone on the services board offer this kind of service to users, although I'm not sure about his credibility or if it's even true. Personally speaking, if you're looking to process a transaction ASAP why not just use a different network instead of bitcoin? I find that using other networks when I make crucial purchases more reliable and less stressful than having to wait a whole day for your crypto transaction to push through. But idk man, might just be me. I just don't see the point of already paying something to process your transaction faster, on top of already paying the corresponding transaction fee in in your crypto network. You're basically getting fucked sideways (just my opinion). Alright, Yapping over, go check the services board and discern whether the guy's honest or not

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: I remember the days The answer for me is still yes,  especially if I have some Bitcoin transaction from my wallet that uses cheap fees to save more bucks.What I only do sometimes and hit google then search using some keywords and a lot of bitcoin transac tion accelerator will pop in the list then I can just enter each the transaction ID there.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Quote from: nelson4lov on November 30, 2023, 10:55:33 PMQuote from: Frankolala on November 30, 2023, 08:26:37 PMOP, you can read this thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5474868.msg63194470#msg63194470 to get more information on ViaBTC accelerator free service. Comments was also made and you can also have more ideas from them.According to OP's last message, the transaction in question has since been confirmed without any sort of transaction acceleration service or utilizing the RBF feature. In hindsight, the accelerator service is hard to get in since it's capped per hour and if the mempool is free, no need to accelerate a tx. Yeah I remember trying to use it back in 2017 and gave up. You needed to set an alarm and at the beginning of the hour try and get your transaction in, most of the time it timed out or it was already full. Eventually gave up and paid the $50 fee to send a small single input single output transaction.This is why from now on I always have the RBF enabled , so if after a day or two it still doesn’t fill I can up the fee and resend it. In the past I got burn this way by having transactions stuck for days.

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Quote from: Krazy-E on November 30, 2023, 03:34:12 PMMike and some others were doing while working for mining pools were top tier help.Thanks for all the inputs.Those were good old days but unfortunately, it doesn't exist anymore, and I don't see any individual miners as well since pools started to dominate the network so they had no choice but to stay in the race. We have alternatives now which are RBF and CPFP that is faster and way cheaper than using a paid acceleration service.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: High priority fee is current at something $1.xx.So that's not going to cost you that much unless you only transact for a few bucks and transfers it with that fee, so it's not that worth it at all. And maybe wait for a couple days and maybe we'll see a digit sat/vB soon. I am hoping and crossing my fingers for that so everyone gets to enjoy the low fees again.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: panganib999 on November 30, 2023, 11:26:05 PMSaw someone on the services board offer this kind of service to users, although I'm not sure about his credibility or if it's even true. If it is a paid service, then it is most likely a scam, all that person can do is rebroadcast your tx which is useless. Sometimes people come up claiming they can accelerate tx's for a fee, but they don't tell us the mining pool they cooperate with, don't trust such members.Quote from: panganib999 on November 30, 2023, 11:26:05 PMPersonally speaking, if you're looking to process a transaction ASAP why not just use a different network instead of bitcoin?I have never recommended that people use altcoins instead of BTC, but i see that some members are now recommending it whenever the fee rate goes high, so yea, it is fine if it works for you people.Quote from: Krazy-E on November 30, 2023, 03:34:12 PMIt eventually passed a few hours back.Good to know that the fee rate dropped and your tx got confirmed.
